sif3.infra.rest.resource
Class BaseResource

java.lang.Object
  sif3.infra.rest.resource.BaseResource
Direct Known Subclasses:
DataModelResource, InfraResource
public class BaseResource
extends java.lang.Object

This is a utility class. All REST resource style class should extend this class. It provides many common functions that are required to deal successfully with SIF3 style REST resources. This utility class helps to maintain request and response properties as well as forming the correctly structured response for many SIF3 REST operations. It fully abstracts many low level SIF3 infrastructure concepts and it also provides a number of useful methods to easily access various properties of either a request or a response.

Author:
Joerg Huber

Constructor Detail

BaseResource

public BaseResource(javax.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                    javax.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders requestHeaders,
                    javax.ws.rs.core.Request request)
Constructor. Initialises the REST resource with a number of important properties that are needed throughout the SIF3 REST resources. If a resource is accessed for the first time then this method will ensure that all environmental components such as the environment store, property files etc are initialiased as necessary.

Parameters:
uriInfo - The URI of the request in its original form.
requestHeaders - All headers of the original request.
request - The actual request in its raw form.

validClient

public ErrorDetails validClient()
If the client is valid then the ErrorDetails returned is null. If there is something wrong, then the ErrorDetails will be set accordingly and returned.

Returns:
See desc

getResourceIDsFromDeleteRequest

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getResourceIDsFromDeleteRequest(java.lang.String deletePayload)
                                                                 throws UnmarshalException
This method processes the low level SIF3 DeleteRequest message and returns its content in a nice and easy to handle data structure.

Parameters:
deletePayload - The SIF3 Infrastructure Delete Request Message.
Returns:
A list of ID that are requested to be deleted.
Throws:
UnmarshalException - If the payload is invalid and cannot be marshalled into its predefined structure.

makeErrorResponse

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response makeErrorResponse(ErrorDetails error)
Converts the ErrorDetails into a REST Response according to the SIF3 Specification.

Parameters:
error - Error Information to be put into the REST Response.
Returns:
REST Response Object.

makeResopnseWithNoContent

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response makeResopnseWithNoContent(boolean isError)
Create a HTTP Response without any content. It will set some header properties as defined in the SIF3 spec.

Parameters:
isError - TRUE: Indicates that the Response is an error response otherwise it is assumed it is a standard response.
Returns:
A HTTP Response to be sent back to the client.

makeResponse

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response makeResponse(java.lang.Object data,
                                              int status,
                                              boolean isError,
                                              MarshalFactory marshaller)
This method creates a HTTP response that adheres to the SIF3 specification.

Parameters:
data - The data (payload) that shall be put into the response.
status - The status of the response.
isError - Indicator if the response is an error or a standard response.
marshaller - The marshaller that converts the 'data' into a valid media type.
Returns:
A HTTP Response to be sent back to the client.

makePagedResponse

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response makePagedResponse(java.lang.Object data,
                                                   PagingInfo pagingInfo,
                                                   boolean isError,
                                                   MarshalFactory marshaller)
This method creates a HTTP response that adheres to the SIF3 specification. Paging Information given are added to the appropriate headers in the response.

Parameters:
data - The data (payload) that shall be put into the response.
pagingInfo - Paging Information to be added to the response header.
isError - Indicator if the response is an error or a standard response.
marshaller - The marshaller that converts the 'data' into a valid media type.
Returns:
A HTTP Response to be sent back to the client.

makeCreateMultipleResponse

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response makeCreateMultipleResponse(java.util.List<OperationStatus> operationStatusList,
                                                            javax.ws.rs.core.Response.Status overallStatus)
This method creates a response to a Bulk Create request. The payload of this response is defined in the SIF3 Specification. This method ensures that the payload follows the low level Infrastructure definition of the response.

Parameters:
operationStatusList - List of status for each object that was originally requested to be created.
overallStatus - Overall status of the operation as specified in the SIF3 Spec.
Returns:
A HTTP Response to be sent back to the client.

makeUpdateMultipleResponse

public javax.ws.rs.core.Response makeUpdateMultipleResponse(java.util.List<OperationStatus> operationStatusList,
                                                            javax.ws.rs.core.Response.Status overallStatus)
This method creates a response to a Bulk Update request. The payload of this response is defined in the SIF3 Specification. This method ensures that the payload follows the low level Infrastructure definition of the response.

Parameters:
operationStatusList - List of status for each object that was originally requested to be updated.
overallStatus - Overall status of the operation as specified in the SIF3 Spec.
Returns:
A HTTP Response to be sent back to the client.
